title: HD Payroll Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard. Received an email asking for a phone screening with their HR recruiter, went well. A couple of days later, received an email from the supervisor requesting and in-person interview that lasted roughly 45mins long. Was invited back for the third round of interviews to meet with the DOF a week later. Was informed that I would be informed of their decision about a week later. My rounds of interviews took place over Oct 4-Nov 11. Did not hear back from hiring manager two week later. Decided to reach out and see the status of the position. Was informed that no decision was made and would receive a decision after Thanksgiving break. Received no information after said break. I was informed about their decision to move forward with another candidate early Jan with a short email. Loved meeting everyone on the team just wished their was a better understanding of communication.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you made a mistake and how would you correct that? What skills do you have that you can bring to this job? Tell us something about yourself that is not on your resume? Why do you want to work here? Are you familiar with GLACIER, Salesforce, etc. ? What are some job duties that you have in your current position that are transferable to this job?

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California

Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this role?

title: IAM Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied to their IAM Administrator opening through their website. Their recruiter reached out to me the next day to set up a phone interview. The phone interview is very basic like going over your skills, experience, goals, what USC has to offer and etc. I passed the phone screening so next is meeting with someone from the team. This was a virtual interview and it was basically just about talking about yourself to see if you would be a good fit for the team. I was also told here that for this role, there 6 rounds of interview. There no technical questions here because that is saved for the next round with the main people of the team. The third interview was a panel virtual interview where you'll have to introduce yourself again and everyone else introduce themselves. They will also ask you technical questions here about Active Directory, SSL certificates, how would you enforce certain security, are you familiar with salesforce and etc. The forth interview is on-site and meeting the team to basically do the same thing again if asked. After I did the forth interview, I never heard back from them again and I didn't try to reach out because throughout the whole process since the beginning the communication was excellent. The recruiter I talked to would tell me if I advance to the next round within like 2 days of the interview. But this time since it been 3 weeks and I haven't heard anything, I figure they wanted someone else if I didn't hear back. It's not the best way to treat someone but it is what it is. They have good perks if you join the institution and will let you work from home on certain days if needed. Since I didn't hear back and we never went over salary, I took another offer that is closer to me and pays very well.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with salesforce?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was non-existent because the interviewer never showed up to the scheduled time and never followed up to apologize! How professional and delightful. 

Imagine if I never showed up to an interview I  committed to Iris, you'd be frustrated as I was right? 

Please if anyone is considering applying here do look some place elsewhere as you will not get a fair share.

title: Communications & Editorial Strategist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Process overview:
- Applied May 2022, ghosted by July 2022
- Total time: 2 months+
- Total time spent interviewing & prepping: 7 hours
- 1 phone screening
- 3 interviews (2 over zoom, 1 in-person that required traveling to USC)
- 1 take home assessment (1 hour 15 min)
- Met with 5 people, including head of department

The process was straightforward and engaging. I enjoyed meeting everyone on the team. Hiring manager/supervisor for the role was communicative and helpful throughout, up until the last month. After the take-home assessment was completed in early June, all communication seemed to cease. I politely checked in a few times over the next month (June-July) and only received one automated reply to all candidates stating that an update was coming in 1-2 weeks. Four weeks pass by, nothing since. 

It doesn't take much effort to be courteous and drop a note. Don't drag your candidates through a two month long interview process only to ghost them.
Interview Questions: What are some communications strategies you'd like to implement?

Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at USC? Tell me about yourself.

title: OIS Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: submit app, receive phone call, asked about why interested, hypothetical situations, data entry experience... quick and simple, the interviewer was very nice so it felt easy. If I were to prepare better, I would look through the website clearer to answer any potential questions.
Interview Questions: time and schedule, whether able to work for 20 hours

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Had higher expectations for a org of this caliber, esp in position of need.  Too much time in between communications. Didn't receive an offer but I'll be okay with that.
Interview Questions: Describe your qualifications for this role.

title: UX Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Only 2 rounds of interviews, an HR screen and group interview. No design challenge. The team was clearly burnt out and unhappy. The interview felt like an interrogation. No one introduced themselves and jumped straight into questions. It was evident leadership lacked experience designing in other environments and did not have the fortitude advocate for her team. I would not want to work here.
Interview Questions: How do you keep up with industry trends and what is an example of using what you learned?

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds of Interviews. The first is a group, the second is solo. Make sure to think about how you are working with other applicants and not just your responses.
Interview Questions: Least Favorite part about USC ?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: First, the interviewer did not respect the scheduled  interview time at all. Second, the interviewer is extremely rude during the interview and did not even seem to slimly care to answer the candidate's question.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to working in Los Angeles

title: MBA Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Interview was a zoom video call, so dress appropriately. Asked basic questions to get to know me, such as strengths and weaknesses, five year plan, etc. Interviewer was friendly and nice. Interview was recorded
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: The process at Marshall was comprised of a Virtual Campus Visit. Candidates prepared a lecture, job talk, and had interviews with the search committee and deans. Students met separately with candidates. Overall, a very positive and welcoming experience. Great students, and great faculty!
Interview Questions: Lecture, job talk and meetings with faculty and deans.

title: EM Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: It was a multistep process, but it was smooth. Human Resource Department kept me up to date on next steps and status. Interviewed for multiple people and group disciplines (law enforcement and university officials).
Interview Questions: How do you define Organizational Change?

title: College Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: After applying I was offered a phone screening, basic questions around 20 minute call to gauge interest. Next was invited to do a group interview, and finally an individual interview.
Interview Questions: If a student came up to you distraught about a missed deadline, how would you respond?

title: Grants Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview with the manager first. She was nice. However, after that I had interview with her supervisor who was a Doctor. I was able to answer all his questions with ease . He asked me if I'm a US citizen which I am. At the end of the interview, he said (paraphrasing) "but you're not from here". I was just speechless after that and knew that I won't get the job.
Interview Questions: The usual interview questions plus not so legal ones.

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Interview was done over the phone. Had to reschedule a couple of times due to technical issues. They asked a couple of questions about my experience and it took about 20-30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience working in a lab?

title: Supplemental Instruction Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and conversational. It took probably 15 minutes. They just wanna know that you are a people person that can handle students and be friendly towards them. I would say just be yourself.
Interview Questions: What resources would you recommend to students?

title: College Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed over Zoom with 2 others and was asked to collaborate on advice for students/recommendations. We were emailed some documents to review ahead of time. Had a short info session at the beginning and a question and answer portion at the end.
Interview Questions: They presented you with the profile of 3 students and asked you to discuss which one you would recommend for a scholarship and why.

title: Director of Stewardship and Donor Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: One-hour interview with two managers. The interviewers asked for experience in fundraising, though the job description does not include fundraising.  They also asked some tricky questions about donor policies. In the end, they already had a candidate in mind for this position.
Interview Questions: If you are to describe this position in one word, what would you say?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: In a panel format, 4 people interviewed me. They each asked me one question, and then I was given the opportunity to ask questions. It was only about 25 minutes.
Interview Questions: What is your long-term plan with this degree

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly interview with both 1-1 and group discussions. Got to meet faculties and current students introducing their own research and expertise. Very informative and made you feel welcoming and comfortable.
Interview Questions: Basic questions about your own research interest and experience

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The phone screening itself was a positive experience. The interviewer made me feel really comfortable and we had a nice conversation about the organization, role, and my experience. Hearing back afterwards took awhile even after following-up, which I thought was odd since it was a phone screening.
Interview Questions: Asked about my experience relative to the position in a broad sense.

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Good interview with interesting questions. Asked about prior research experience with lots of details. I asked about transcript and testing info as well. Be prepared to talk about involvement in past projects.
Interview Questions: What did you do in your last job

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions:
They ask standard behavioral questions and a few situational questions too.
dress professionally when going in for interview.
Definitely helps if you know someone who used to work there.
Go in 10 minutes early.
Interview Questions:
Am I able to  come in early at 8 am?
What would you do if someone asked you a question that you did not know the answer to?

title: Teacher´s Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for the Teacher's Assistant position at USC was both straightforward and pleasant. The teacher who interviewed me was very organized and kind, making the process overall enjoyable.
Interview Questions: Q: Are you available to attend class each week?

title: Research Programmer I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: One director for behavior questions and one programmer for technical questions. Technical questions are pretty simple. They don't even use angular....Just HTML and CSS...Answering the technical question on a word file.
Interview Questions: Simple HTML and easy level SQL question.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by HR and then upon approval was interviewed by my supervisor the next week. Both were pretty typical and lasted about 40 minutes. Upon my last interview, we signed paperwork that day.
Interview Questions: How would your contribute to the stability of the organization?

title: Senior Integration Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions:
The interviewer was 20 minutes late to the Zoom interview that they had strongly suggested I take as very formal. I reached out by email and the interviewer asked for my cell number. He called me and interviewed me for less than 10 minutes while paying attention to other things and asking me to hold a few times. 

I then followed up with the contacts I had by email 3 times to ask how the process was going and if there would be any next steps, with no response.

I was informed i was no longer being considered 3 months later.
Interview Questions: What do you know about WD Studio

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Nice people to deal with, the interview process was easy, because of the pandemic, everything was virtual and remote. During the interview people were nice and didn't ask too many difficult questions. Ended up doing two interviews with two different people.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Animal Care Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Very simple, quick, but sudden phone interview. They did not schedule at all, just called me randomly in the morning. The interview focused on my relevant experience, my ability to travel to the work location, and my ability to communicate via writing. It was difficult to convey that last one over phone.
Interview Questions: How far away are you from USC?

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Short, and depends on research PI. Mine was smooth and asked about my background in research and my interest in this particular lab. Described any skills or experience I had that could be applied.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in my lab?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Standard Questions about software engineering and computer science principles. Also more behavioral questions as well. Will vary depending on the person you are interviewing with. Was interviewed in a group setting by the team for about an hour. Was informed the next day.
Interview Questions: Described a software project you built

title: Lab Operation Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview, and the process took about 20 minutes.  It was focused on duties I had in my previous position, what expertise I gained, that were relevant to the job description.
Interview Questions: What was a difficulty you faced while performing this specific research? (Referred to a research topic from my CV)

title: Major Gift Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Level one went very well, and ended with   the promise of a call for Level two  in two weeks. Upon followup, a  terse  reply  stated that  there was no answer for multiple reachouts and they had moved forward.
Interview Questions: How would your experience translate to this role?

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Completed a phone Interview and was asked to come and sit in for a  panel interview with employees of different departments. The interview itself felt more like a conversation.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with media relations?

title: TRIO Academic Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Met with the director of Trio in an online interview where he asked me questions regarding my previous teaching experience and also explained in detail how TRIO works at USC. The interview was informative.
Interview Questions: What has your experience been like working with TRIO?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Process moved fairly quickly. I had my phone screening, 1st and 2nd interview in the span of two weeks. Interview panel was extremely professional, welcoming and willing to expand on company info.
Interview Questions: How would you handle difficult situations?

title: Research Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions:
1. Self-Introduction : tell me about your self and please describe past research experiences
2. Trivial Questions CS knowledge : 4 questions
3. Interactive Programming Question : programming related to word search
Interview Questions: Please explain what is git-rebase?

title: Research Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I was reached out by the HR. She took my contact information to forward to the department. I soon got an email with a technical challenge that I wasted several hours and submitted a working solution. I never heard back from either person despite my multiple email follow-ups.
Interview Questions: Solve a technical puzzle regarding RDFs.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a Double Interview Process, first with managers then with a Program Director. The whole process took about three weeks to get an email offer and onboarding took about another two weeks. Overall very great experience!
Interview Questions: Experience preparing you for this role?

title: USC College Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: After a 10 minute phone screening, because of the COVID-19 season, candidates were asked to select a time slot for the group interview to follow. Candidates were then sent a zoom link and an article to read over, prior/in preparation for the group interview discussion. Candidates were then asked to attend 5 minutes prior to the start of interview. After the group interview session, candidates were told to expect another interview (one on one with the coordinators (presumably) within 2-3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Suppose you are hosting a workshop soon but, you can not pull up the presentation as there is tech/wifi issues? How do you go about this obstacle?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Three part interview, cultural fit, experience / skills and case study. There were fit interview questions regarding the role and the decision for the application. Questions regarding the skillset applicable to the role and previous experiences.
Interview Questions: Please review this case study and be prepared to give a detailed analysis.

title: Project Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very smooth through two rounds of interview. The interview format is flexible and might depend on the position. Overall, extremely good experience with very kind interviewers
Interview Questions:
Competencies in coding
Past work positions

title: Public Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: The process was straightforward but because of the nature of the university power structure, took some time for final decision to be made. I first had a phone interview with the department business officer. That was followed by a phone interview with the manager of the department I was applying for. Then an in-person interview with the business officer and finally a series of interviews with the managers involved in the hiring.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: First, phone interview, including four questions,  and then Onsite. After onsite, if everything is good, they will send you an email. Then you need to send your interviewer three recommendation letters. Then you just wait for the result.
Interview Questions: Machine learning techniques and computer vision

title: Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: The process is quite slow, it takes weeks. I think it took at least 3 weeks for me to hear back about the application itself. I first received an email about a phone screen and then after that it was a virtual interview with 3 of the other advisors. The next round was an on-campus interview. I appreciated that they were very transparent with their timeline.
Interview Questions: What do you look for in an office?

title: Research Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview, one online video interview (was living out of state). Was hired for a temporary project in the engineering school. Mostly research based, a lot of work with people.
Interview Questions: Challenging team enviroments

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: My friend introduced me to the research team. When I came in, I talked with the graduate researcher and sat through a research meeting. At the end I wrote my email in the sign in sheet. A week later, the lead professor tells me that he saw my email listed on the sign in sheet. I tell him I was simply a visiting student. He then told me if I wanted to join the team and to send me the resume. Suddenly I was on the research team under a famous Biomedical Engineering professor of USC.
Interview Questions: What's your email and can I see your resume?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Two phone interviews, two in-person interviews, and at least five verified references.   The hiring process easily lasts for months.  Spoke on the phone with HR manager and office manager directly above my position, in-person interviews with three managers.
Interview Questions: What in your background makes you qualified for the position?

title: USC Receptionist  Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter called me and submitted my resume to the company.  First round interview was a phone call, then followed by in person interview, which then lead to another in person interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me what you least enjoy about your current job?

title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Campus, OH) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Two phone interviews and then one in-person interview that took around 40 minutes. Ask you specific questions to see how you would handle specific situations. Very casual, friendly, want to see if you are a good fit.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a conflict?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is a multi-stage process for hiring new employees. The interview process typically includes the following steps: writing a job description, posting a job, scheduling interviews, conducting preliminary interviews, conducting in-person interviews, following up with candidates and making a hire.
Interview Questions: If you had a magic wand, how would you create an advising environment.

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: informal interview process . was asked .net mvc questions . was asked windows forms questions . interview was for one hour . very pleasant office . two rounds of interviews . was rejected
Interview Questions: past experience

title: Senior Marketing Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: The job title and interview questions made this appear as if it was a senior level position for an experienced professional, however the salary offered at the end of the interview process was not commensurate with the level of experience that a senior professional in this field would expect.
Interview Questions: what is your experience level

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Typically some kind of interactive group or just interactive interview in general. Every year is a little different but it’s all about showing your passion and experiences. This is followed by a individual interview.
Interview Questions: If you could build your ideal building at USC, what would it have?

title: Auxiliary Services Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Paper Application, One Thirty Minute Interview with a couple managers, and then received job offer. Pretty Straight Forward process, pretty much just asked how you would handle certain situations regarding customer service.
Interview Questions: How would you treat a disgruntled employee?

title: Academic Advisor II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: The academic advisor application is first reviewed by a recruiter who reviews your application then sends it to the specific department you applied for. After this step a phone interview with the department takes place, then you may move onto the in-person stage with is the final step.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a crisis with student? Team culture.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I met a company recruiter at the career fair. Two weeks later I received an email inviting me to take a video interview. A week after I received an email to schedule a phone interview for the following week. It was a very pleasant interview. A week after the phone interview I received an offer
Interview Questions: Why USC

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: I applied online after having the position recommended to me by a former colleague. After filling out the application (CV, CL, and Position Questionnaire) I received a call to schedule a phone interview about 2-3 weeks later.
Interview Questions: Unsure - still pending interview

title: Project Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: 3 hour interview with 3 managers from 9am to 12pm, 1 hour per each manager, conversational but they bring a sheet of interview questions, they tried to make you feel comfortable
Interview Questions: Previous job experience related to this position

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Short interview just for your supervisor to get to know you and see if you would work well with everyone else at the library. I think what matters the most about this is that you should appear as someone who gets along with other students since that's who you'll be working with most of the time.
Interview Questions: What was a challenge that you overcame in your last work experience?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Originally submitted application online and got asked to do a phone interview almost 2 months later. Interview went rather fast with pretty basic questions. Got called back for in person interview with two of the staff. Again, went quicker than expected and pretty straightforward simple questions. Most questions related to what I currently do, how I could apply it to that department, what are my strengths, why that department, why I think I’d be a good fit for the position, and etc. there was also a timed writing assignment.   After interview I sent thank you email, and they asked for list of references. Got offered the job one week after.
Interview Questions: Read the mission statement and describe how it appeal to you personally and professionally.

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very professional phone screening interview. All the priority interview questions were asked . The interview was  5 10 min and was very unexpected.. but be prepared for many questions .
Interview Questions: What are you goal s

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application online, was contacted by a Senior recruiter. Phone interview didn't go so well for me, but I was still brought in for in-person interview. I was ultimately not hired for the position. Was very surprised that I got an in-person interview as my phone interview only lasted about 18 minutes.
Interview Questions: How is your experience dealing with International students?

title: Investment Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Tell me about yourself. Very behavioral interview. Was not too bad and the people are friendly. I  believe they have added a case study to the interview process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your experience?  Why do you want to work here? What makes your a great fit for this role?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: It was a two part interview process. One phone interview to receive basic information about myself and what I am looking for in a position. The second interview was an hour long that required to bring my own project and present.  The in person interview was efficient, pleasant, and of average difficulty.
Interview Questions: Describe an event you coordinated.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: phone interview, skype interview, on-site interview. Final step with several professors in the research group and some student helpers in that group too. The professors are nice but the waiting time for the whole process is pretty long.
Interview Questions: What will you do with these data offered

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: First had a phone interview, then had a phone interview with the directory of the department, then finally was invited for an in-person interview where 15 min was a 1-on-1, 15 min to answer your responses to common issues in this job, 15 min to take an exam for excel and finally 15 minutes to ask questions.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working with a diverse population?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Very short - one phone interview, one in person interview with four employees (two current coordinators, manager, and Vice President of department) asked pretty standard questions, a lot of room for more personal talk which was a nice touch. I was contacted about one week after in person interview with job offer
Interview Questions: Past experience using Salesforce?

title: Technology Transfer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Applied on line and through email with resume and cover letter. It took 2 weeks to receive a phone interview invite. phone interview--30 minutes phone call with the director. I followed up but did not receive reply.
Interview Questions: How to engage with Pharma industry and license university inventions?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: easy, friendly, low pressure and casual interview with supervisor that felt comfortable. pretty standard student job interview with questions about your work ethic and how you handle various stressful situations, what customer service work you have already done and how it could benefit the qualifications for the job, and just general personality questions to see how you would match with needs of work environment
Interview Questions: questions about schedule, experience, and how to deal with rude customers

title: Front Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Was very straightforward, involved all the details necessary for the job and all the good stuff you need to know once you start. That's how it all goes love what I do and all that.
Interview Questions: Where did you work previously?

title: Student Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Screen. Then 2 person interview with department director and grad program manager. After I met with faculty where I spoke to people from a plethora of departments from the sciences of biology and computer science. They also had some graduate students interview me and ask some tough questions. They were nice but there was some power plays happening on the backend as to who got final word as to who was interviewed (came to learn this later). I heard back fairly quickly. Make sure to apply early as I was told they selected only the first 50 applications and disregarded the rest (over 200 people applied).
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why USC? What are some examples where you had to deal with a tough coworker? Every planning?

title: ITS Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: SImple and easy to crack, just keep calm and tell about the details in a clear and concise manner for a higher chance of selection into the company, so definetly a doable interview to crack
Interview Questions: How much can you work for a week?

title: Grad Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions:
Sent in my test scores/essays/letters of rec.
I knew I got in a few months. The good part about USC is that they don't wait with their admission decisions, they are very swift with them
Interview Questions: Why Chemistry?

title: Research Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions:
I was talking with the group leader about my research experience.
The two other scientists were asking me several questions related to deep learning, very practical issues. 
I think the overall experience is challenging but friendly.
Interview Questions: things about the deep learning

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was brief and informal. I came in and my interviewer had my resume printed out and asked me questions about my previous job experience and availability to work.
Interview Questions: What days and times are you available to work?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had two video interviews within the same week. I was then called in for an in person interview. This was a few hours long since I had individual interviews with multiple people including the director, assistant director, and research coordinator.
Interview Questions: Name and describe three traits about yourself.

title: Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: After I submitted my cover letter and resume, 2-3 weeks I recieved an email about being interviewed. I was interviewed directly from my boss. It was professional. There was a little small talk in the beginning to kind-of break the ice.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met with program manager and director. Very nice experience. Was asked about my experience and background. Both people explained position and their expectations. Opportunity to ask questions. Offer came later the same day.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to teach? What can you offer students?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Had a phone interview (30  minutes) followed by an in person interview with a panel (60 minutes). Panel members were friendly and took turns asking questions.  The usual interview questions, also gave me time to ask them questions.
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized?

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Was not easy to answer to some questions. There are  many specific technology questions related to your position. In general all pretty standard  and straight forward.  They also seeking if you are team player, which is make sense.
Interview Questions: Give me some experience of Linux services and please describe how they work

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions:
2. National income and product data are generally revised. What effects would the following revisions have on consumption, investment, government purchases, net exports, and GDP? 

It is discovered that consumers bought $6 billion more furniture than previously thought. This furniture was manufactured during the current year in North Carolina. 

	GDP would rise by $6 billion and investment in furniture rises by $6 billion.

2. National income and product data are generally revised. What effects would the following revisions have on consumption, investment, government purchases, net exports, and GDP? 

It is discovered that consumers bought $6 billion more furniture than previously thought. This furniture was manufactured during the current year in North Carolina.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Already knew the individual previously. Great place to work; however, they need to work on their culture and internal promotions.  They need to break down barriers - very siloed mentality.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Administraive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Great! It was very easy and the interviewers were very personable and sweet. They made me feel comfortable and like I was talking to a friend. They didn't throw in any curve balls or unpredictable questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Assistant Professor, Clinical Pathology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: The whole day interview with multiple people and have to give a grand round lecture. It is a whole day process. Nice environment. I highly recommend.  Please work there
Interview Questions: What is my career plan?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: It is one hour 1 on 1 breakfast interview hosted at a meeting in a co-hosted hotel. Greetings, breakfast, then asked about my paper, past collaborators, and future research agenda.
Interview Questions: What is your research agenda?

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: They reviewed my resume and introduced me to their offices and staff. Explained to me what they expected out of me and introduced to the person that I was going to be working with the most.
Interview Questions: They asked for my availability and skills.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Cool. easy questions. mostly about myself and previous work experience in a related field. Time availability. Passion for work.  Willingness to adjust among co-workers, friendly and social outlook, Love for the profession
Interview Questions: What timings are suitable for you?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: You apply online as a student and eventually you get an interview if they like your resume and it fits their role. You get a basic behavioral interview with them and they also ask you questions about their department. Make sure to research.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: My first interview was a phone interview which I passed.  I made it to the last round of interviews which was VERY EXTENSIVE. The interview lasted for 3 hours. I went before three different panels. The first panel had 2 people, the second panel had 4 people, and the third panel had 6 people. From the time I applied for the position til the notification of not receiving the job was three months. I applied in June and was notified in August that I was not chosen. That is extremely frustrating especially when one is unemployed.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for USC?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: asked me lots of technical questions and other things to check the background knowledge, asked for the reference letters and also asked my availability, asked for my capabilities and contributions in their lab projects
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: After a brief phone screen with HR, I interviewed in a 5:1 group setting with the hiring manager, his boss, and three peers. The interview was awkward. The setting was intimidating and the questions seemed not well-considered and more designed to trick up the interviewee and boast of  their detailed knowledge. When I asked questions of the hiring manager (new in the position managing at least 12 engineers) about his management background, his boss answered with a list of prior technical accomplishments, not management background.
Interview Questions: They drew a network diagram on the board and asked what is wrong with this picture? The diagram was ambiguous in its use of non-standard symbology, so it wasn't clear what they were trying to achieve.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: talk with professor about future plan and his lab current status, communicate the project and own interest, introduce past research experience, talk about future work schedule and discuss training details
Interview Questions: what do you expect from my group

title: Chief Investigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Did not get past the first step, when it became clear that salary offered was way, way too low. They also did not cover professional due and you had to pay for your own parking.
Interview Questions: Describe experience, background and why you are interested in the position.

title: College Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: It was a brief group interview where we were asked to collaborate and brainstorm ideas on how to implement a college mindset/environment within a specified high school campus. It was challenging as it was my first group interview where we had to work as a team on the spot to come up with feasible ideas that would help facilitate/guide students into post-secondary education
Interview Questions: What would you advise a student whom missed a deadline to submit test scores for college admission review?

title: Webmaster (Student Worker) Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: In person behavioral/expectations interview with phone interview as well. Since this was a student job it was more about getting to know me as a candidate. However, referrals were called and asked about me as a person.
Interview Questions: Asked about skills and other personal/behavioral questions

title: Surveillance Operations Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: The process is lengthy. First you take a written test to qualify you. If you pass. You have a panel interview with about 3 people. Then you are referred to a clinician for a Psych evaluation. Once you complete that you are referred for a Medical Evaluation. When you pass all the hiring requirements you start orientation/class room training.  The initial hiring process is about 3-4 months and you will be in training for about 3 months maybe a little more if you don't catch on to everything swiftly.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Interview was a casual environment with typical interview questions.  Dress to impress. Be prepared to stay for nearly an hour. Also be sure to arrive early to find a parking spot!
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Career Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I sent my resume in and waited for months for an interview.  During the interview I was told about another position, Office Manager, and was told about the importance of making sure that there were enough highlighters in the office.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were more in line with the Office Manager position and if I was okay performing office tasks that are more in line with an entry level position rather than the 20 years of managerial experience I had share on my resume.

title: Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Look at my portfolio and I'm on the board! It really didn't take any effort, to be honest. It's more of a skill test. He literally showed me autocad and started talking about projects.
Interview Questions: Can you take on XXXX tasks?

title: Events Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I received a phone call which ended up being a quick phone screen. By the end of the call, my in-person interview was scheduled. 
First met with the director then with the team.
Interview Questions: What is your preferred management style?

title: Regulatory Affairs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews over several platforms (first round phone, second round phone, final round in person). I was offered the position though the pay was not competitive, and the university charges employees a lot of money for parking, so it didn't financially make sense.
Interview Questions: Why USC? Why do you prefer Academia over Industry? Generic situational questions

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions:
talk to people, went to the office visit library and campus
did a typing and word processor test
met with the chair of the department, professors and students
hello, hello, hello, hello
company, company, company, company, company

title: Events Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Resume screen with two follow up interviews. Interview process was direct and to the point. Know your resume and you should be good to go. Also doesn't hurt to bring a letter of reference
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this role?

title: Research Assistantship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2018
Interview Questions: how do you hear this job

title: Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: lots of talking to people, no real technical questions, seemed like I just had to have a good personality to get the job, they didn't ask me any real coding/ statistics questions
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Student Worker At the USC Office of Cultural Relations & University Events Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Event Services Manager for an interview at the office after finding out about the job through a family member. The process was standard and straightforward -- I was asked about my previous work experience and some skills that pertain to events and customer service. There were a few situational questions as well. Overall, it was a positive experience and    I felt that the interview was conducted very well.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work at the events office?
What does customer service mean to you?

title: Data Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the Dornsife College of Arts and Letters, Program for Environmental and Regional Equity. 2 on 1 interview. They briefly explained the position then began to ask me questions.
Interview Questions: What native american archetype/role would best describe you? The lead interviewer proceeded to read off 4 different character descriptions for categories named things like "the healer" or "the warrior"...

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening which led to two ok campus interviews a month later. I found out I was not hired by a automatic email sent from HR. Very impersonal follow up processes.
Interview Questions: How do you organize your time?

title: PhD Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview with the professor. He asked me general question about my work and why I'm interested in joining his research group and pursue my PhD. It lasts for approximately 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why you are interested in joining us?

title: Lab Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: It was a very informal interview. They just want to make sure you know what you're talking about. They are very big on safety, so they will ask you a lot about precautions that should be taken when using the machinery.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience in a machine shop.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy. Went into the office, submitted an application and talk to the head of the department. I got a job on the spot. Was referred to by a friend.
Interview Questions: What year are you in school?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Just go through the resume, ask about the tech stack, difficulties and so on. Basically if you get a solid CS foundation, you could answer the questions. No algorithms, since they just want students to get their wok done.
Interview Questions: Tell me about this project

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Quick interview with one of the post-doctoral scholars. Nothing too scary, just straightforward questions not intended to scare you. They just want to make sure you're interested in the field that you are applying for.
Interview Questions: What is your GPA

title: Orientation Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Pretty fun and engaging interview process. 2 rounds, first round is a group interview, second is a one-on-one interview. Be prepared to show spirit and to speak on your experiences at USC.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite memory at USC?

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the University career portal and was contacted after 3 days. The whole interview time was brief about 15 min and it was through Skype. The interviewer was nice and quick to answer my questions.
Interview Questions: Talk about your relevant experience

title: College Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The structure of the first interview was a group interview. There were three candidates in total. The interview consisted of introductions, a discussion about a provided reading, direct scenario questions to each candidate, a discussion among candidates about a particular topic, and an opening for questions about the job.
Interview Questions: Scenario: A student who has been accepted to a 4-year university comes to you and tells you that he is considering community college because he does not think that he is academically prepared for a 4-year university. What do you tell him?

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Describe how to achieve a data structure and get two pieces of papers with students' answer on it. After found the error part, get the offer. The first question is about Balanced Binary Search Tree, how to implement one with a sorted array. It's kind of red-black tree problem.
Interview Questions: How to implement a Hash table

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I got hired on the spot! If you have a warm personality and handle the call well you should get hired (they give you script a few minutes before the call and then you manage the call with the recruiter as if it were a USC alumni giving money).
Interview Questions: It’s a mock fundraising call. They will act like the alumni you’ll be calling to raise money for USC. Read over the script, and walk them through a pitch.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Referred by faculty. Reached out to director with interest to apply. Submitted resume and writing samples. Interview with director. Easy HR process. Multiple training sessions on all systems. Had time to shadow others.
Interview Questions: How will you manage time

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 one-on-one meetings and then a half day to meet the team.  It was not anything out of the ordinary for a development position.  There was no human resources meeting which seems to be the norm now having left that position years ago.
Interview Questions: Why USC and why now

title: Customer Support Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met with the manager to discuss previous work experience. Provided various examples of what you would do in certain situations. Discussed knowledge of technology. We also reviewed the resume I presented.
Interview Questions: What did you do in a situation where you faced a challenging customer?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The position was really about personality and capabilities. My interviewer presented me with the job expectations first and then asked how capable I thought I would be to do the job, and I felt very capable and I was.
Interview Questions: Coffee or Tea?

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Just an informal interview with the professor. He will ask basic questions and then he gives you offer if he likes and then you will be forwarded to HR manager. the whole process takes 2-3 days.
Interview Questions: General question related to course

title: Education Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: First did a phone interview that went really well. This was with the Director. Then I was asked to come in for an in person interview with the Manager. That was mostly personal questions, nothing regarding skill. I feel like they had already chosen who they were going to hire.
Interview Questions: They asked about salary expectation

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview with the head of the lab I applied for . The person who interviewed me asked me questions about my background and previous research . Describe my scientific publications and my main contributions.
Interview Questions: Mainly questions about my background

title: Special Events Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had one phone interview which was poor quality because it was a conference call. It took almost 4 weeks for them to get back to me after I had continuously reached out to them.
Interview Questions: Would you consider yourself detail-oriented?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: It went very smooth. I gave a talk. Then met with all the group members and saw what they did. I asked them a lot of questions too. They took me to lunch. Then talked with the boss at the end of the day and said that he is going to offer me the job. He took me dinner later on and that was it. I got the job
Interview Questions: Are you a good fit for the hiring position?

title: College Adviser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: There is the group interview where you review an article about college access with other candidates and if chosen, you will be invited to a second interview where a presentation is prepared about college and then a formal interview follows.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a challenge you faced in a group setting and how you resolved it.

title: College Adviser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews total. It is a very selective process must have a passion for youth, community and serving first-generation, low income students. They give you a article to read before interview and thats in a group interview and the following second interview is a panel. In the second interview, you have to present to the panel a presentation of your choosing (college-related) and the panel act in character to high school students. You don't need to get their attention just make sure you keep your cool and deliver they eventually cut it short to see how you deal with a rowdy classroom. It is difficult at first but again if you have passion you'll do great. The pay isn't great but if you love working with youth and helping them toward higher education you will love this job.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working with youth?

title: Research Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview first, then in person one on one interview. First ask about my background, and then more details about the work I've been doing, and the projects they currently work on.
Interview Questions:
Q: Tell me about your self?
Q: Have you been working on XXXX?
Q: How do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview started with taking a basic math exam to see if I can count. Then I met with two supervisors and we had a brief chat. It was not a bad interview. It was fine.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: It took 10 to 15 minutes. She asked about my experiences and future plans. She did not talk too much. Interestingly she was in Starbucks and eating something. I expected that she would ask some questions regarding my explanations.  It was my first interview and I disappointed.
Interview Questions: What do you bring to the table?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Very easy over Skype. I. was Interviewed by one person. I was asked about my goals and why I chose this place. Also they asked me about my plans after graduation.

title: Student Developer Interview

Interviewer basically asked me about the stuff I am interested in and what I have upon in the past and my educational background.
Will you be able to work 20 hours easily every work without disturbing your studies?

title: International Office Interview

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)

title: Museum Educator Interview

Interview Descriptions: 1 to 1 with the director (who was more than 30 minutes late) in a room of the USC. No specific questions. It was a 45 minutes interview without any dynamic, I asked the main part of the questions.

title: Writing Center Consultant Interview

title: Business Manager Interview

The interview panel went over an hour's time, which is always a good thing.

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview

Interview Questions: what would you prefer to do if you meet some bad attitude students?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2017

Interview Questions: My experience with Outlook

title: Writing Center Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was, overall, very informal. I felt comfortable in the interview environment, which was based in an office. The interviewers were friendly and genuinely interested in my responses and opinions
Interview Questions: Past experiences relevant to the job position

title: Phd Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Southern California in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process involves an initial phone call interview followed by an on campus interview for second round.  Applicants outside of Los Angeles area will be accommodated with housing during the visit to the campus.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in our program?

title: Several Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I have had 3 interviews with USC now, all different schools within the institution. The first interview was a "pre-screen" type, conducted over GoToMeeting. One was a panel interview with 2 supervisors and a third party, and the most recent was one-on-one with the supervisor for the role. Despite sending thank yous and appropriately-timed follow ups, I never heard back from any of them. Not even a generic "we chose somebody more qualified" form letter email. Is this USC policy, to leave candidates hanging until they lose hope? I was assured by all that I would hear from them either way, and I know this is common experience because I have been a job seeker many times in my life, but I expect better at an institution like USC.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you made a mistake and what you learned from that experience.

title: Adminsitraive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was called and then interviewed twice after in person. I met with the admin team as well as the senior management. Once the interviews were over, I was offered the position over email and signed papers with HR the following week.
Interview Questions: How do I handle fast pace environments

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Fast, easy, simple. Email them my schedule, and I was in. But the department is really careful about selecting which students to work for them. Students have to be responsible and have a good history in classes.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Just one round with a board overviewing you. Really quick and easy, but they interview a lot so make sure you stand out! Definitely recommend doing a lot of research about this position and what it entails.

title: Clinical Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Conference call with several interviewers. Friendly, pleasant and some explanation of what the job would entail. Lasted for about 30 minutes

title: Academic Advisor Interview
