title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone call, which was long. Then I went for an on-site interview and finally got an offer. It took a long time to get the letter offer though due to the new year event.
Interview Questions: Some questions about my background and papers I have published

title: Tour Guide, Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: A few days after applying  via the company website, the Director of Business Development,  and Sales and Marketing responded by email for me to anticipate a call from the recruiter.
Interview Questions: On what job site did you find our ad?

title: Research Tech II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Specifically asked questions involving thed department and the ongoing processes withing the department. Be prepared to answer niche questions regarding your role within the lab. Overall, a friendly atmosphere and if you know your stuff, then you should be fine.
Interview Questions: Q: Have you handled biological laboratory procedures?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very basic. A professor interviewed me, as I am applying for PhD program at USC. The interview process was very smooth, he asked me about my past experience, education and etc. Nothing really challenging, just basic questions. Overall, the interview was a good experience and nothing to complain.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past projects.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Quite relaxed, it was very conversational and they allowed for a lot of time for me to ask questions. The interview was mostly a long "tell me about yourself" or "walk me through your resume" question.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Academic Advisor In Accounting Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online as a previous USC employee. Took about a month to hear back and received an email from the assistant director of advising asking a few questions about my background. From there an in person was scheduled which was 1 hour and 45 minutes long. Met with the assistant director and other advisor and then the dean of the department. Didn't hear back for about 2 weeks. Then heard back asking me to come in a day later to give a presentation titled: what will I bring to this position? Came in to give the presentation to the assistant director, no one else, and was told this was the final step. Asked for my references and was told I would hear back early the following week. I had to reach out AGAIN because I hadn't heard anything by Thursday and according to my references, no one had been contacted. Instead of a response to my email, I received a rejection letter. Hands down the most ridiculous interview process ever. So much time and effort spent and the references asked for were never checked.
Interview Questions: What's the last book you read?

title: Bus Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: They talked to me about the requirements to work there and I met all of them. They also talked to me about the benefits of working there. They also talked to me about my experience.
Interview Questions: What was your previous job?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Columbia, SC) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Above-average professionalism, good interpersonal skills, attention to detail all required. 
The most common way of achieving an interview is through a current employee or professor's reference. 
Often starts with email communication, followed by several in person meetings and one interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview with the Senior Assistant Director of Financial Need Analysis at the Financial Aid office of the University of Southern California. Interview lasted about 30 minutes. Then, we went on to discuss the compensation and benefits and my availability in terms of work hours for the job.
Interview Questions: What factors do you feel make you a perfect fit for this job?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: You turn in an application that requires essays. There are two interviews. On one day you will have an interview with two people and a group interview in which you work with others to solve a given issue. In the second interview you will interview with 2-3 people who work for the department currently about why you are interested in the position and situational questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an RA?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions:
Applied, a few days later they gave a phone interview with a person from HR. The questions were generally easy and the person does research about the college you work for and the department which is why it is important to be honest. I felt very good about the interview but there were times  where I could tell he thought I was being untruthful. Working at a small liberal arts college compared to a large research university means how we perform our jobs different. I reminded him he has my supervisors contact information should he want verification. 

However I was very qualified for the position. I believe the deal breaker was that I wouldn't go lower on my pay requirements. Having a masters and the high cost of living at USC means I want a decent pay. If USC, an institution with tons of money, doesn't want to pay then I don't want to work there.
Interview Questions:
How do you think you can adjust working at a small college compare to working at a large university like USC?

A Standard Diversity Question/

title: Driver Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: very very easy, with another student. I interviewed with a friend who had been working there for a while.  starting pay and everything was discussed. it was very relaxed, basically a formality to see if I was competent enough to not crash a car
Interview Questions: do you have a california driver's license

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth, talked directly with the doctor in charge, very thorough in explaining the position.   Asked why I was interested in this position when I didn't have prior research experience.  And concerned about my commute since it was over 1 hour.
Interview Questions: Do you have previous research experience?

title: Desktop Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: 1st interview then 2nd interview; Beginning with your present job explain to us what you do and how you arrived at this position in your career. Preparation was assisted by Prosum Staffing who provided many basic and useful reference materials for review. Lots of useful tips on things people assume they know but need to review in any case. No one is so far above reviewing the basic requirements of proper interview techniques, both on the phone and in person. I still have those materials and just reviewed today. They were quite professional in all their assistance and presentation. In any case they did me a great service in preparation. I would  recommend this agency to anyone seeking a professional presentation before a prospective client. They cover all the bases! We were both close to signing. It happens.
Interview Questions: Can you deploy the entire System Center Suite?

title: Project Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, then Skype interviews with department head, and two of the teams I would be working with under the role. Overall it was an easy process. after Skype interviews, I came for an in-person. A few days later I was offered the job.
Interview Questions: How often do I work in a team atmosphere?

title: Computer Service Consultant II Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Be prepared. A lot of questions are asked.
Some technical questions such as NSLOOK, IPconfig , some customer service questions, logic problem solving questions. some situation scenarios are also given and you are expected to analyze the problem and give an overall solution
It was pretty a difficult interview for a Tier 2 Tech position
Come really prepared.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you will make a great candidate for the position?

title: Project Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: An executive director called me within a few days of submitting my resume. An interview was scheduled within one day. I had a phone interview with the Associate Dean of the department which went well, and I was asked to come in for an interview with multiple executive directors. We spoke for a couple hours, and I was told that I would receive a call within the week regarding my application.
Interview Questions: They asked me what a manager would tell them if they asked what I needed to work on. I thought that was an interesting question to phrase it a way that would ask for a point of view from someone who is my superior.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: A friend recommended me to the boss, so there was not much to talk about for myself. We only talked about basic job duties and schedule availability and then moved on to work
Interview Questions: Are you good at teamwork

title: HR Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied via LinkedIn initially, then via ATS. Contacted around April / May, interviewed during the summer. Took months to offer and then they wanted me to start right away. I was able to delay start date for my needs.
Interview Questions: Panel interview with reports

title: Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I thought the interview process would be formal, so I can in a business suit, It was actually SUPER casual, the interviewer had on jeans and sneakers. They are very laid back and the interview is mostly just to see if you are reliable, presentable, and would be a good fit for their quirky work culture.
Interview Questions: What is your definition of defensive driver?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions:
It was pretty easy since the discussion was about my previous work experience and my profile.
Have to speak highly about your USC experience, talk about how you would enforce USC policy, and display great public speaking skills. Freshman (especially spring admits) are at a disadvantage in the hiring process because of their lack of USC experience (many are told to apply again next year). Other USC jobs (such as working in res ed or as a tour guide) is very helpful as well.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this role?

title: Orientation Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
Have to speak highly about your USC experience, talk about how you would enforce USC policy, and display great public speaking skills. Freshman (especially spring admits) are at a disadvantage in the hiring process because of their lack of USC experience (many are told to apply again next year). Other USC jobs (such as working in res ed or as a tour guide) is very helpful as well.

The interview process when I applied was just about who you were as a person, but now there is a group interview process where you have to prioritize orientation problems as a group in front of a panel. It's fairly easy to do and not very many people get cut from the group round.
Interview Questions: Q: What's an object that represents your USC experience?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Remote, OR) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was on skype. All my different technical projects were discussed and questions were answered based on that. 2 rounds of the same were done. It was on skype. All my different technical projects were discussed and questions were answered based on that. 2 rounds of the same were done.
Interview Questions: Describe your projects.

title: Production Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Marina, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Face to face interview with accounting manager. Face to face interview with Production Manager. Face to face interview with director of the division and face to face interview with the director of the institution. Performing a typing test.
Interview Questions: How would I respond if someone got combatant or irate with me?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was brought in and questioned by the program director and her assistant. The job requirements were elucidated to me and we discussed the difference between the industry I was exiting and the one I hoped to join (academics). After a series of questions, I was asked to take a "quiz" in the form of writing a cover letter for a "student I had once "taught". Throughout the whole process, the interviewers were warm, yet professional.
Interview Questions: What are your plans for the next five years?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very open and friendly more of a discussion than a formal interview. As a suggestion it is best to bring a portfolio, dress professionally and be prepared to answer generic interview questions and questions related to the role you are applying for.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. They also asked questions specifically about the cover letter and resume.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Nice person and great environment; very friendly interview; researchers are nice and talkative; however, it is a bit long for interviewing; four round and meet with different professionals; overall it is a good interview experience
Interview Questions: Why USC

title: Family Care Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied and was contacted for an interview within 2 weeks, which I found to be rather quick considering their process takes much longer. The interviewer was very down to earth, did not make me feel intimidated whatsoever. A lot of the interview consisted of the interviewer talking about the department, the department was rather new. I did not receive an offer because they told me that they were looking for someone with more experience.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this position?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Simple skype interviews that did not take very long.   There were two rounds total, meeting with the project manager and then the director of the department.   It involved some questions about my past projects and why I was passionate about working there.
Interview Questions: What are past projects you have worked on?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was told by the student director that a professor was personally inquiring for me to assist him in a course he was going to teach. I was interviewed over Skype. I was told to share my portfolio. The interview was about an hour, as we discussed course work and backgrounds.
Interview Questions: Have you taught before?

title: Cvt Job/EKG Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (East Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Don't never ever go there. Not even as a patient. This hospital is too dangerous. The. Medical students are the ones practicing on sick and terminal patients. I worked there. Easy interview. It took me 15 min to get the job. Since I came from dif. State good backround and credentialing active. No one went to school in my unit. After Hugh school they did 3 days course at american heart associacion. And guess what? They're dealing with cardiology patientes and injecting nuclear meds without Drs supervision. They do really kill at this facility. Especially KECK which is where the students practices. Dont go there please. Don't not even bother to work also there. They got the lowest pay in southern of California. Its just the name USC. Plus the parking lot if far a way. And most of the time they broke into the cars. The shuttle takes like 45 min to come and get you. I worked there and just telling the real true. Co workers are nasty. No manners. Jealousy. They refused to train you because they not even know what they are doung.
Interview Questions: Do you want the job? After they checked my resume and credentialing. Making 15.00 hr

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with Associate Director.  On campus interview with entire advising team and Assistant Dean.  I submitted my resume and cover letter at the end of October.  Phone screen happened the beginning of December.  Invited for an on campus interview before Christmas.  Received offer right before the New Year.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working with diverse populations?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I found the job online from the website of USC, and make an appointment for the job I applied. During the interview, there are two professors, and we begin to talk about my resume and the tasks that may have for this job. It's  a very nice meeting and I received the offer in few days later.
Interview Questions:
1. previous project
2. future plan

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Since I got As from several courses that I had taken, I submitted the application for the position that is available for me in our education system. And I got the email giving me the offer and asking if I would like to accept. After short communication with the professor, I started the job as a grader.
Interview Questions: Just the availability since I got good score in this class before.

title: Scholarship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
Got to see a lot of the campus, went on a bus tour, a couple information sessions. They do a great job of getting you to love the campus and the university life. On the last day you have a short, 15-25 minute interview.

After the interview you go to a nice luncheon with all of the other scholarship. Make sure you make the best impression possible upon all of the staff- they all will rate you, not just the people who interviewed you.
Interview Questions: What other schools are you looking at?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Met with a manager and head of a lab to discuss goals and knowledge of the area I wanted to research. We talked about the responsibilities, safety hazards, and scheduling of working in the lab. Everyone was very nice and welcoming, it seems they encourage undergrads to do research, whether or not they want to go to graduate school.
Interview Questions:
What do you want to research and why?
Why did you become interested?

title: Senior Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Their recruiter reached out to me via LinkedIn, then I had a phone screen.  Then invited in for in person with 2 of their team members, then invited back for 2nd in  person with the Director and other team members.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a situation with multiple hiring managers /stakeholders with differing views during a job search?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: it was an in person interview with 2 people interviewing me and asking me questions. I felt as though there were too many people interviewing me and that the interview was a bit challenging. They asked me where i saw myself in 5 years, which is such a weird question because i cannot understand what they would want to do with me in 5 years.
Interview Questions: what are some of your strengths?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview.  I sent in an application and got an offer letter.  The application process was similar to applying to colleges from highschool.  They asked for a statement of purpose, resume, and GRE
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Services Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Whole thing took a little over a month. It was about one month after I submitted my application when I got a phone call to schedule a phone screen, (this was on a Thursday). Phone screen the following Monday and was told they would let me know by Friday. When she said this, I assumed they would let me know by Friday if she wanted me to come in for the second interview. However, I get a call on Wednesday to come in Thursday for the in-person interview. In person interview was essentially with the staff I would have been working with. They were all super friendly, but the executive director for that department was a little off-putting. Out of the corner of my eye, I could have sworn I saw her like rolling her head to the side out of boredom. A lot of the questions they asked me seemed like they came up with them right then and there after they had the chance to look over my resume and ask me to tell them about me. I'm super disappointed that I didn't get the position, (my fault, I should have sold myself better,) but this was a good interview experience i hope to interview with other departments that I applied with.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Leavy Library Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was all about personality. Pretty easy call. If you get an interview, you have a 75% chance of getting selected. They provide minimal california pay. Most of the questions were regarding strengths, weaknesses and how we deal in pressure situation. Can get a call only with employee referral.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness?

title: Front-Desk Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
What are some Talents you can bring on Board? We started with that question, but the reality is that I think they were looking for workers not slackers. They went through some non-descriptor questions about my major in University as well as the foreseen conflict between academic and work.

Please be neat and courteous. They are a bit slow, but they really will just about hire anybody who has federal work study.
Interview Questions: Do you have Federal Work Study?

title: Pro Shop Attendant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Short interview process and seemed desperate for employees. Submitted an online application, was asked to interview a week later.  During the interview they had me fill out payroll information and added me to their scheduling website.  Pretty much instantly hired.
Interview Questions: Do you have any previous experience in sports.

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Super easy interview, had to solve basic math questions, manager was very clear on instructions, friendly and willing to help, be prepared with resume, the shortest interview i have ever taken in my life
Interview Questions: Can you work during football games?

title: Events Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Great! Spoke with several different people and got a good sense of the team. The office seemed really nice. Plenty of time for questions. They asked very relevant questions and nothing generic.
Interview Questions: Previous experience.

title: Disability Services and Programs Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was arranged promptly. The interview had three senior faculty members and was prepared with questions that pertained to the job description. None of the questions were random or too difficult to answer.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working with marginalized and underserved populations.

title: Accounting Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online a few days before the application closed. Got a call a day or two after the last day to apply. They gave me a brief run down of what the job entailed, the pay, and we went over my qualifications. They asked if I was still interested in applying and scheduled an interview.

At the interview: Typical interview. Tell me about yourself. How does your previous experience relate to this position. Are you familiar with xxx software.
Interview Questions: Typical questions. Nothing out of the ordinary.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Good process. Asked basic questions on food handling and safety. Had to pass a food handling exam to meet the requirements of the position. The manager was very friendly and the interview was not at all intimidating. Also, black shoes and pants are compulsory for this position. Handling of meat is one of their concerns. If your not ok with handling meat then don't go for it.
Interview Questions: How many hours can you work?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: No problem at all - just the continuation of the work with my PhD adviser.  Continuity of the same research under the same funding project. Same friends and same environment.
Interview Questions: Where you see yourself 3 years from now?

title: Legislative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Sacramento, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Casual but very formal in the content of the interview. You have to be passionate about public policy and growing academically and must be able to convey it in your interview.
Interview Questions: What public policy issue is the most important to you?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and then a few days later, was emailed to come in for an interview. It was surprisingly informal, and at the end the manager asked when I could start.
Interview Questions: What did you do at your past roles?

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Received an email on a Friday to schedule an interview for the following Friday. Upon arrival, I had 20 minutes to do a writing sample based on a question that focused on my current job responsibilities. I interviewed with three individuals that work in the department. The interview was very comfortable. They asked a series of questions about my capabilities and past work experiences. A copy of the questions were provided to me to follow along. The interview lasted about 45 minutes. 

A couple hours after the interview, they started calling my references. I then received an email that same day requesting information to perform a background check. I was offered the position the following Monday.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job? Tell us about your background that prepares you for it.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Great experience. Def. learn alot through the process as you will speak with representatives who support students at a Tier 1 institution. Everyone I spoke with were professional and respectful. Def. come prepared knowing the department you are applying for.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness and why do you see it as one?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The process was very professional and informative. Come prepared by focusing on the department and/or office to ensure you know the culture, objective, and purpose. Prepare examples and review interview questions. Stay true and humble.
Interview Questions: What is the greatest obstacle you encountered and how did you overcome it?

title: Library Security Student Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Short and brief. The manager asked me questions related to my communication skills and people skills.I was asked to explain how I would react to various scenarios and then I was explained my different roles and responsibilities.
Interview Questions: Hardest team decision I had to make.

title: Faculty Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen first by the person currently holding the position. Then set up an interview. The interview was quick with the person currently holding the position and then with the faculty member the position was going to support. Simple straight forward questions. No tricks, more conversational to see if there was a personality fit than anything else. It was an entry level position so there really were no skills questions more just about getting to know me and my personality.
Interview Questions: Most all questions pertained to my resume.

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial telephone screening; This involved a 30 minute conversation. Following the call, I had two additional in person interviews. I met with a committee and had an individual meeting the department chair.
Interview Questions: What best prepared me for the position.

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: We had a very nice meeting, We went over my qualifications and work history. I was hired on the basis of my work as a lawyer and judge. Good follow-up via email. I interviewed with an assistant dean at his office.
Interview Questions: Asked about compensation, and syllabus.

title: Project Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted to schedule a phone screening.  They discussed required salary at this point which I thought was a bit strange.  After the phone screening to review my qualifications, they scheduled an in person interview that was relatively short to meet the prospective supervisor.  Within a few days, the supervisor phoned to offer the position.
Interview Questions: What is your 5 year plan?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: all key people in the room for lively discussion. they asked good questions but not canned. it was a lively conversation. i got to ask all my questions as well.
Interview Questions: How do you manage faculty?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Had to present my PhD work, questions were easy, they also asked about the length of commitment that I can make. Heard back from them within a few days and got the job
Interview Questions: How long do you see yourself staying here?

title: Project Specialist Interview

Interview Questions: Have you worked in a university setting before?

title: Student Worker Interview

Interview Descriptions: Contacted the manager via email asking for any job opening he had in his department. HR was only involved in the process of hiring and no one from HR interviewed me.

The question were like how would you add a printer on a network, getting the MAC address of a PC, how would you change a graphics card or a hard drive on a computer and other similar questions. He kept the interview quite informal.

title: Research Assistant Professor Interview

I did not have to go through traditional style of interviews as in industry setting. I just spoke informally with the group that I would be working with.

title: Finance Interview

The interviewer called at scheduled time he went through a series of standard questions such as, "Tell me about yourself", "What are you strengths"...
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience streamlining or optimizing a business process and give examples.

title: Project Specialist Interview

the interview process was quiet lengthy, as I had to go through 4 interviews 
the interview questions were more behavioral, not so much skill-related

title: Campus Cruiser Interview

title: CAD Student Assistant Interview

title: Customer Service Representative Interview

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line and the PI invited me for an interview, it took around 3 weeks to arrange that. So I think interview process in university can be different from labs to labs. It is according to the PI taste and in my book it is not that professional. The PI asked me about my background in research and my master thesis. Then he asked what was my opinion about doing my PhD, I think this question is crossing the professional barriers and getting personal. Then he said I should do my PhD. Then he asked another personal question about my clinical background and he said are you thinking of passing the exams and working in clinics. Then he asked technical lab questions and I received the job offer one week after.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself
Why do you want to do research
What is the GC content of a primer
How to design a primer

title: Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by manager for a meeting. The meeting lasted about 20 mins where we just discussed the job profile and spoke abut my experiences and why I would be a good fit.
Interview Questions: Do you have web designing skills?

title: USC Admissions Processing Center Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, if you're a USC student and there is a position open, you will get the job. The interview is more of a warning that the work is monotonous. title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was great and I have nothing else to say about that. I would recommend anyone to interview at the University of Southern California. Also, the people here are so nice.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2015

title: Human Resources Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2015

title: Student Worker Interview

Interview Descriptions: Work study is required for this admissions processing position. I was referred by a friend who worked here and was told to contact the manager. I sent the manager an email and an interview scheduled the following week. The office is often hiring and the interview process is extremely simple.

title: Executive Assistant Interview

title: Library Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: What previous experience you have in managing  a Library. At school or college if any? I said yes during school I had done it in a library for few months
Interview Questions: Will I be able to work at various shifts at various hours in the day either night or day. Will I be able to work continuously without sleeping as a librarian needs to be active all the time.

title: Lab Technician I Interview

Interview Descriptions: the lab professor asked about my future goal, my research experience, whether I can work with mice, etc. Every question was related to laboratory work, and all were expectable. The professor also asked if I have question about the job and research. Actually, I only prepared for answering the question, so it was little bit embarrassing. I think it is good to bring some questions to ask to the professor.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Special Projects Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was very simple. I had a brief phone screening, then I had three in-person interviews, two of which were conducted the same day. My first interviewer ended up being my boss. She was very communicative during the entire process.
Interview Questions: What are your long-term goals?

title: Human Resources Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met with both potential supervisor and colleagues.  Met with the supervisor's supervisor also. Provided strong sense of the culture, environment and working conditions.  Additionally, provided a brief presentation on human resources and customer service.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had an assignment and were unable to complete the assignment by the deadline.  What did you do?  What did you learn from that experience?

title: Payroll Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview with a recruiter. Next, I was invited to participate in an in-person interview. Interview took roughly 30 minutes. All basic questions to get to know the candidate. Wait time for a response is around two weeks.
Interview Questions: All basic questions. Ask to describe yourself. Why did you choose to apply for this position? Do you work well in high stress environment?

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: There was no interviews at all. The professor sent an email to students who have completed that course. If you are interested in the job, just send an email to professor. The professor will make his choice.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Received an email about scheduling an interview. Interview went well asked normal questions about last positions and schooling. Asked for references. was told to email references after interview. waiting for job offer as we speak.
Interview Questions: the waiting process...

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Typically, you will receive an email if they want to meet you.  The next step is for you to have an interview.  They're open to skype.  You will have to come well prepared and know facts and history about the university.  Make sure your experience is relevant to the job you're seeking. Sell yourself.  Tell them why you want to work for USC.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Program Director, Center for Urban Education (CUE) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by an outside consultant, who was assisting the organization with their search.  Those present in the interview included: Drs. Besimon, Dowd, and Wong (the Center's founder and co-director, the co-director, and the executive director respectfully).  It was almost immediately obvious that my CV/resume and cover letter were not carefully reviewed in advance of my interview.  As a result, the interview lacked focus and direction. There was a lot of skipping around, and the interview felt more like they were simply interested in obtaining free consulting advice than filling a position for which they had a clear vision. Many of the questions were a colossal waste of time since the questions posed were simply basic information that were obviously reflected in the first page of the CV/resume.  Within 10 minutes, it appeared that they were not entirely sure they intended to fill the position.  I had a sense that not everyone was on the same page about why the position was created, what the vision for the position was, how the position 'fit' in the overarching organizational structure, could the responsibilities be met by an existing staff member.  In the end, I do not believe that the position was every filled...confirming my initial suspicions. All in all, the experience was not unpleasant, but it WAS a waste of my time since it was obvious they were not truly committed to filling the position.  On the positive side...everyone I met was polite and very professional.
Interview Questions: Where did you work?

title: Contracts & Grants Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a friend. The process took about 2 weeks total. There were basic interview questions asked in a group forum. The team was very friendly, and was eager to learn more about me.
Interview Questions: General interview questions were asked. Like for example what are my strengths and weaknesses. Where do I see myself in 10 years.

title: Tour Guide/Admission Ambassador Interview

title: Research Lab Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview process went very smoothly. They were very transparent about the job's scope of work and responsibilities over the next calendar year. The interviews were highly professional and challenging but the interview environment was very friendly.
Interview Questions: How does this job fit into your career plan over the next decade?

title: Phlebotomist Interview

Interview Descriptions:
To obtain a position as a research phlebotomist with the USC-UCLA Center for
Population Health and Health Disparities to use my medical science background as a
Licensed Phlebotomy Technician I and Certified Medical Assistant. With over 8 years
of experience supporting and executing the standards of phlebotomy practice and

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Graduate Application, this is a standard process.  There is not an interview.  You complete the application, and if you're resume and undergraduate work is good enough, you may get accepted ingot he graduate program
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2014

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I met with the principal investigator for about an hour. She was very interested in my plans for graduate school, and didn't seem to want to pick a student who was looking for a resume boost.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: USC has a website for student jobs, including work study and non-work study. Positions vary but most of the libraries hire every semester. I applied to most positions online and received an email back from one or two. I chose to work in the libraries because it was relatively quiet, independent work and I enjoy reading and looking through books. They invited me for an in-person interview (no phone), and offered me the job later that day.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Laboratory Arts Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
I heard of the job from my boss at another company. He was teaching at USC at the time. Since I knew people, the process was smooth. One interview with the interested parties and the following week got an offer. This was over ten years ago and the process has changed. If you are applying from the outside and not knowing anyone, you will have a different experience. You may not hear back for a long while, or not at all. I have applied twice to jobs in other divisions and I did not hear back from one. And the other I got a courtesy interview after the job was given to someone else. USC will post jobs that they have already picked out an individual that they want. This is normal for all universities and most corporations. The new process is all online. You log in and create an account. The procedure includes uploading resume and cover sheet. 
The environment varies depending on the school. Few schools have a fun exciting work place. The experience differs if you are staff or faculty too. Most staff that have been there awhile are burned out. They are for the most part nice people. The college environment is fun.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Adjunct Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Somewhat informal, but the process still included interviews, submitting a CV, and submitting recommendation letters.  By "informal," I mean it was more of a conversation than a QnA test with someone in administration.  - Glassdoor demands 50 words minimum for this field, but brevity is the soul of wit and the balm for any busy person - which is every employer.
Interview Questions: None. Advice: Don't keep talking if you don't have anything else to say, even if they just sit and stare at you... or volley with a question of your own.  I.e., don't be afraid of silence.  Be humble, but confident.

title: Dental Patient Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: 1st was the 20 minute phone interview, 2nd in person interview. It was supposed to be a panel of 3 interviewers and only 1 showed up. He said they had something else to so they couldn't make it. I have a feeling they saw me in the waiting room and didn't want to waste there time with me. I have all the qualifications on paper and obviously over the phone but i feel they were looking for an image that I don't have because of my weight.
Interview Questions: List me all of the job descriptions posted on the usc website.

title: Intern Interview

i met with two people and they were super nice not intimidating at all... very friendly

What my interests are.... Why i wanted to work at Marshall
What my major is and field that I may want to go into.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview

title: Clinical Project Manager Interview

title: Accounting Technician Interview

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California in May 2014
Interview Descriptions:
This is for PHONE interview only:
Sent in online application for a Student Admin Assistant role and maybe a week later received a phone call for an interview. They wanted to fill the position quickly, and while it was kind of in the lower range of where I wanted to work I really wanted to get my foot in the door of a University campus. 
The lady who interviewed me was working from home that day and her baby was crying the whole time, I just thought that was funny.
In the end it kind of seemed like it wouldn't work out because she mentioned she was looking for someone with University exp (I had none) and I even though I did have 3+yrs of growing admin skills, there were better candidates for the position.
Interview Questions: Very routine/expected questions, a couple situations thrown in, they were definitely looking for someone with experience working in higher education though. I had no background in that so try to emphasize heavily on your admin experience that is similar/could apply to the position if anything.

title: Cashier/Soto Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: It took a few months to get an interview after I kept calling to check on my application.  I even called on the weekends to leave a message (I believe that´s what got me a call back). Finally they called my back weeks later to give me an interview the following week.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: SCA Student Worker Interview

title: Business/Budget Analyst Interview

title: Office Assistant Interview

I interviewed with the lead artist then interviewed with 4 other staff members who had no knowledge of art development or its processes.

title: Student Library Assistant Interview

title: Student Worker Interview

title: Freshman Academy Coach Interview

Next you simulate a day in class when the professor suddenly asks that you fill in time with an activity or icebreaker. You and a co-interviewee will become co-coaches to devise, execute, and assess the activity.
Interview Questions: How would you engage a student like this (interviewer pretends to be glued to her/his device)?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2014

They brought a copy of my resume with them so that they are able to ask me questions about my resume. They basically ask whatever comes out of your mouth. Therefore, you should be cautious  of what you tell them.

title: ITS Customer Support Consultant Interview

Interview Descriptions: It started with Mervin calling me on my phone and then we set up a time for the interview. They didn't require experience because the first two weeks on the job they teach you everything you will need to know. It was good!

title: Cafe Assistant Interview

title: Student Library Assistant Interview

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a a skype interview, asking about research experience and stuff like that. Questions was not hard, I just had to describe what I was working on before, and tell them why I applied for University of southern california, what my expectations are
Interview Questions: Why did you choose USC?

title: Clinical Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Casual interview, no behavioral questions, Just background questions about past work experience and education. It was obvious that they were trying to see if I was qualified for the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Guest Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty easy, They just want to know your schedule of classes and contact info. They only call people if they are hiring. You get the interview you get the job.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Basically it is the same as applying for PhD position in any other universities. You take GRE, submit application with personal statement, which details your research goal. It is better to know the faculty in advance or at least know their work by reading papers or contacting them directly. They will call you if interested.
Interview Questions: What is your research idea?

title: Accounting Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: It took about four months to get hire. I apply for the position through their website. Two months later I got an email from HR and had a one-to-one phone interview. Three weeks later I got another phone interview with 2 people from my department and another from the finance department. One month later I was called for the face-to-face interview, at this point they were deciding between 10 people and myself. Three weeks later I got an email from USC requesting 3 reference, at this point I think it had been boiled down to another applicant and myself. The interview process was technical, questions with regards to the use of computers, what would you do in this situation, why did you applied for USC, tell me about your self, how long do you plan to be here were common questions.
Interview Questions: There wasn't any unexpected questions. I did my research regarding the regular type of questions you get asked in the interview. I was honest with my responses and I used example of work experience for each question. I think using work experience example made the difference because it showed I was a reliable applicant and could assumed the responsibilities of the position.

title: Facilities Attendant Interview
