title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Sent in initial application and cover letter via the large USC HR system online. Received invitation to first interview about 2.5 months after applying. Went to first interview, which was conducted by a department panel. Was asked to do a second interview a week or so later with just the department head.
Interview Questions: Most unexpected question in the interview related to a previous project I had done working with students. Even if the position you are applying to doesn't include direct contact with students, they will ask you about it.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Plan and implement a comprehensive departmental and campus life orientation for incoming Asian Pacific American undergraduate students. Work with departmental programming and initiatives, including, but not limited to the PEER student mentoring program; CIRCLE leadership development program, Connections! career mentoring program and/or APASS Download weekly dialogue program. Please visit our website more detailed program descriptions. Compensation:	$12-14/hour; work-study preferred Dates of employment: mid-August (3 months) - up to 15 hours/week from mid-August through mid-April (8 months)
Interview Questions: How do you communicate with international student?

title: Assistant Director of Admission Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview to get an understanding of my interest in the position. Then an in person interview that was behavioral to get a sense of your personality and fit for the position. Then I gave a 10 minute presentation on USC. Lastly, I did a mock review of an application. Then you get to meet with two people who are currently in the position that you are interviewing for.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in College Admission?

title: Administrative Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Screening interview, first interview, second interview with the departmental staff, offer position
Interview Questions: Discussed resume and given open-ended questions based on what the department does.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume and cover letter online, got phone interview pretty quick. Behavioral questions. How closely you paid attention to what the interviewer said really mattered, cuz he asked at the end.
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: phone interview and person to person interview and decision
Interview Questions: no difficult ones

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Single FTF interview, interviewed by the supervisor and the director. Got a reply in 10 days from the date of the interview. Major point of discussion was communication skills as the position required someone with that quality.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply here?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: USC send an email notifying that they accept us as a graduate student. A few weeks later, they will send us a letter of acceptance by mail, which we should complete and send it back. Next thing is, they will send us an I-20 (for non-US citizen) and USC booklet. Last but not least, there will be a professor who will contact us
Interview Questions: Basically, the question is about our research experience, which should be easy to answer for a graduate student

title: Summer Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Simple Interview w/ hiring staff
Interview Questions: What was a time you had to exhibit leadership?

title: Japanese Language Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Saw the job posting on the UCLA website, applied through e-mail and got a phone call to schedule an interview with them. The office was located in downtown LA, kind of industrial looking side of downtown ,I think the building belongs to Warner Brothers since there are W.B. logos everywhere. I met with the supervisor and he asked me some basic questions about my background and my experience in high school, since the job is related to the upward bound program. Then he asked me some questions about "what would you do" kind of question, answered them with common sense, and 3 days later  got a phone call saying I got the job. Overall an easy process and the interviewers are nice and friendly.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your high school experience.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, simple questions. I think that could be very different for other positions, but in my case I was applying for a position for which I guess a very specific skill set was needed (risk analysis) and I happened to be a good match for it.
Interview Questions: Typical questions like, tell me about yourself or how do you see yourself in ten years times

title: Business/Budget Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a panel of 4 people. They were basic questions and nothing really difficult that I hadn't already prepared for. Just make sure you know enough about the position so you can seem like you know what you're talking about. It helps to know a lot about the systems that they are already using in place such as Kuali or Cognos. Just show that you're a fast learner and easy to get a long with and they will like you. It's often hard for them to find good candidates so it's not hard to stand out.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stress?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: Talk about experience on algorithm research, any rewards, research direction. Some detailed breakthrough while dealing with a hard problem. Plans on further research.
Interview Questions: Detailed breakthrough on dealing with a hard problem. Sometimes, I have explain as detailed as I can. But the project I made was large.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was called for an interview after applying for the job.  We scheduled the time and location and the manager sent me email with the details of the interview.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current position?

title: Research Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Culver City, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied the intern there, and got hired after intern. The interview is dependent on the project. Every project leader will have different interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Alumni Association Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions:
They had info sessions. The first round is paper application, which followed by two rounds of interview.The second round of interview involves with a mixer with current student workers, staffs, and alumni. They want to make sure that candidates can well represent the university.

They also want to know how you can serve, as this position is similar to a volunteer role. It is important to demonstrate your genuine interest in helping students to be more connected to alumni.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Facilities Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview as a student worker. You just have to show up and show that you are trust worthy and a competent worker. Dress for the interview and show up on time.
Interview Questions: Can you work with your hands, willing to get your hands dirty? paint, patch, learn carpentry skills?

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: First email and schedule an interview talked on the phone and asked questions based on work experience than scheduled in person interview took 2 days and asked similar questions regarding past work environment desired pay and situational questions.
Interview Questions: What are you look for?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: university of southern california graduate school is really friendly in terms of interview. as long as you demonstrate your true passion for your future research and capacity of accomplishing your graduate study (here I mean ph.d), you are likely to be enrolled. and stipend was good too, for graduate student. work and study. what can i say? it is a good choice if you are looking for higher education experience with certain pay.
Interview Questions: tell me in detail about your current research project

title: Libraries Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions: there is only one interview and questions are quite basic. Asking about advantages of personalities which would contribute to do better job
Interview Questions: asking about your short comings

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Found out about position through former employer who knew researcher. The researcher/professor called me in, and we had one interview 1-1.
Interview Questions: She asked me a lot about my prior experiences.

title: Engineering Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California
Interview Descriptions:
I initially heard about the opening from a part time employer. I ignored the opening until I had grown weary of having 2 part time jobs.
The process is based on an online form that is archaic. The job may already be promised but for legal reasons they have to post it. So you may be wasting time. Never give a salary requirement unless it is necessary. Otherwise you might not even get a second look. If you do have normal salary requirements, most of the jobs won't pay it.
The interview was nothing special. I think they were already hoping I would fit.
Interview Questions: I didn't have a question that was unexpected. I got answers that I didn't expect. i.e. you have to pay for your own parking and the work week is 37.5 hours.

title: Part-Time Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview is simple and easy.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Campus Center Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: They asked me general questions about RTCC and university of Southern California. They asked me what do I like about the university and stuff. They asked me to arrange chairs and tables
Interview Questions: Arrange chairs

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: After applying for the program, invited to campus for a full day of interview with other potential applicants; including group sessions as well as individual meetings with up to 5 professors
Interview Questions: What do you want to research while you are here and how will you do this?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions:
3-4 technical rounds will ask you develop a software product and demo it. 
First Round is written test where you will be asked technical theory question on algorithms, datastructure, HTML, CSS , Databases and Aptitude etc.

Second Round will be There will be on the spot question while you demo it. 

Third round will be the same as the second round where they will as you to develop a very small working prototype in their office within a couple of hours 

Finally there will be face to face interview with others
Interview Questions: How will you design a information retrival system for 50GB data in file system (no database querying allowed) to give result within 3sec always

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Got A in the course I work for, then I contact the instructor for an opportunity of grader.
Professor offer me the position during winter break. Sign contract with the assistant from our department. Then work.
Interview Questions: There is no interview. I got A in the course and I show my interest to be a grader during winter break. Professor offer me the position. That is all.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Briefly talked about research in the past and what is the future goal for PhD study in USC. 
Talked about undergraduate research in motion correction MRI and works related to MRI image acquisition, processing and reconstruction.
Interview Questions: What research in MRI have you done

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Brief three on one interview where the director asked me behavioral questions and a couple of ones related to the resume. It was very informal and lasted about 20 minutes. Each of the three interviewers asked about 1 or 2 questions, but they were not really hard. The three people who interviewed me ended up being my co-workers for the rest of my job.
Interview Questions: Whether I am a self-starter and to give an example from a past job or other related experience.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. Presentation to the lab. More chatting on the phone about projects and work environment. Extremely trivial process as the lab is very new and not experienced.w
Interview Questions: None. No questions at all.

title: Student Technical Assistant (Student Worker) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Got a call from the co-ordinator, and was called the day after for the interview.
It lasted for about 20 min where she started by asking general questions about what I did, describe yourself, then it got a bit more technical, but fortunately I was able to answer everything.
Interview Questions: How would you handle the customer problem (if everything that you should do to troubleshoot fails) and if no supervisor is available?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: The manager asked me to email him a resume for him to pass around.  I received a call from his assistant requesting me to come in for an interview.  Directions to the office were sent by email.  The interview lasted an hour and I was introduced to the supervisor whom I would work for if accepted.  The process took two months but only because the job was upgraded to a higher classification and payscale.  I felt the hiring manager had my back and was looking out  not only for his best interests but mine as well.
Interview Questions: What salary range are you looking for?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Very long, uncoordinated, little communication, limited to no feedback during the process, hard to find information about benefits on web page, nothing that explained vacation days, etc.
Interview Questions: All questions were expected, standard - very unclear about the criteria that was being used to evaluate candidates

title: Student Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty quick and painless. Met with an administrator from the auxiliary office who asked a pretty standard set of questions. Everyone was friendly and it was not an intimidating process at all. It helped that I was a student who already worked for the department, so it seemed like they highly valued student workers.
Interview Questions: What kind of talents do you bring to the customer service team?

title: Research Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Two part interview broken into separate dates.
The first interview was one on one with a scientist/PI who discussed the opportunities of the position and quizzed me on my background. 
The second interview was an introduction to the entire lab, getting to know each person and what they do. Questions were asked about my work and some questions were related to general technical knowledge of the techniques I performed.
Interview Questions: General question on immunohistochemistry and fluorescent in situ hybridizations

title: Front Desk Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Asked me how I heard about the program and if I was interested in any of the programs minors. I was interviewed by the advisor for Information Technology Program (ITP) and she went through my resume and experiences with me.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted the job?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: There is no real official interview process, at least in my case.  I'm sure that this will depend on the specific school that you want to work with.  I contacted the teacher directly to see if they had any openings and set it up completely through them.  I don't even think there were any specific interview questions asked, I was familiar with the teacher from taking the class previously and the whole process was fairly painless.
Interview Questions: When can you start?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen conducted by recruiter. The phone screen was followed by several in-person interviews,  First round was with interviews with hiring manager; second round was with the manager's manager and third round was with a panel and then the director. contingent offer was extended pending successful completion of background check.
Interview Questions: how do you handle difficult people

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Went to work study fair where they were tabling, chatted with potential employers and dropped off resume, was contacted a few days later via phone about the position and to schedule an interview time, went to my interview, and was called back shortly to tell me I got the position
Interview Questions:
Please go over your resume
What is your availability?
Tell me about an instance where you had to overcome a challenge

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: I knew the professor teaching the class, so he suggested me for the position. Network with your professors.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Educational background, personality, and  working experience  for the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your thesis?

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is one of the few areas that need significant improvement at USC. I submitted an application in February and wasn't contacted until May. I ultimately began working on July 1 -- a six months after applying and I was a top-tier candidate. I interviewed with four people -- one by phone and three in person. Once approved for hire, I had to undergo a background check to ensure that my resume was accurate, but the process was relatively quick.
Interview Questions: Perhaps because the requirements of the job matched my skillset so closely, I didn't feel any of the interview questions were particularly difficult.

title: Office for Wellness and Health Promotion Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: General stuff. They asked questions that essentially just were to understand if you were going to be able to get along with the culture of their office. They also asked about history and understanding of mental health and sexual wellness issues, just to get a sense of your comfort level discussing those topics, as they are an extremely progressive office.
Interview Questions: What is the most important thing university students could benefit from in their lifestyle?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Came down to one interview and very easy. I met with one of the professors I would be working with and it went really well. 
I think that internships at graduate programs are far more interesting for the professors because they like working with students.
Interview Questions: How do you work?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Online application and phone interview
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Systems Analyst I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews in the total process - phone and in-house with hiring manager and his/her manager. It took almost 30 days but process went smooth. Communication was close and clear and no hassles.
Interview Questions: What was your most difficult project you want to share with?

title: Billing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was first called in for a face to face one on one interview. The interview lasted about 15-20 minutes with expected questions such as 'Why should we hire you', 'What value will you bring to our company' and a series of probable situation questions and how you would react.  After this I was required to fill out a background check and complete a background check.
Interview Questions: Do you have any customer service experience?

title: Leavey Library Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: One interview with supervisor, they're usually really chill and ask fit questions
Interview Questions: Behavior questions, pretty easy.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: first go through the phone interview and then for on-site.  For phone interview you are mostly asked about basic algorithmic problems and on-site interview is mostly about coding.
Interview Questions: not so familiar with some specific technical questions liking synchronization.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the school career website, heard back within three days and interviewed the following week. Interview was very relaxed, simply met one on one with the supervisor of the business office. Interview questions were very basic and asked about English proficiency and an ability to use standard office programs such as Microsoft Word and Microsoft Excel.
Interview Questions: Are you proficient in Microsoft Office programs such as Excel and Word?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Casual, short, easy, informal and simple. This was for a very basic student worker position that anyone could do. They just wanted to find someone who was reliable, trust-worthy and fun to be around. Every department does this differently and it isnt a big deal. A nice way to get to know faculty and professors.
Interview Questions: What are you studying? What do you do in your spare time? etc.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the school's jobs portal. It was just a simple submit resume kind of thing. They emailed me about coming in for an interview and I did. Interview was pretty easy, kind of too traditional, but they were more just trying to get a vibe, in my opinion, as long as they knew the basic requirements would be met.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: After I submitted my resume through the company online, I was contacted to have an phone interview. Then, processed to have on-site interview and got offer
Interview Questions: What kind contribution can you connect between your PhD study and our company?

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Send in application
Wait for call
Go in for interview
If you have relevant experience, focus on it
Interview Questions: Almost all the question were standard questions. They just wanted to see if I could handle patrons at the front desk

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (East Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Began with phone interview followed by a team interview and then two 1:1 interviews. Took a bit too long between steps.
Interview Questions: How would you handle being micro managed?

title: Contracts Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Questions are not anything out of the ordinary although there seems to be a preference for internal candidates. There is a phone interview followed by panel interview of the top three or so candidates.
Interview Questions: Standard questions

title: Student Services Advisor I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was a three level process.  First I received a phone interview.  The second interview was over skype.  The third interview was in person.  The interview asked typical interview questions (future goals, job history, etc etc)
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: The department contacted my directly to and the interview lasted aprox. 45 minutes, very professional...  The  know what they are doing at USC in terms of looking for qualified people.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work at USC

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was 5 years ago - I remember everyone was very nice, but took a while for the process from beginning to end.  It took over a month for a decision to be made.  It was probably because the interview took place toward the end of the school year.
Interview Questions: I can't accurately recall - I'm sure we discussed work style and experience.

title: Research Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Met a professor whose classes I had attended earlier, and asked to provide an opportunity for working as a student researcher. He obliged, based on my past credentials. My past background in mechanical engineering and my overall high scores in the courses attended at USC, especially those taught by the professor, provided him with the assurance he required to hire me.
Interview Questions: How fast can you develop a design?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Job talk about area of expertise, interview with faculty committees, interview with vice deans, campus tour, no interview with dean.  Time between interview and actual offer was long, but did have periodic contact with vice dean.
Interview Questions: How would you put our program on the map

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: The process is fine, and I need more time to prepare for the interview
Interview Questions: Reverse a linkedlist

title: Project Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Informal interview
Interview Questions: Very informal, found out about position through a referral from another USC employee. Was hired based on my educational background, personality, and a good fit for the position/USC. I met with my future boss, discussed their research/goals and explained my background. Was hired on the spot!

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant.  Very casual.  Very friendly.  My supervisor had made the decision to hire me as I walked in.  I originally worked in a parallel depart through a temp agency.  While working, I approached the other department and inquired after positions.  They hired me quickly because they already saw me at work.
Interview Questions: How would you handle working with a VIP with media requests?

title: Assistant Professor, Clinical Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was flown out to meet with division chiefs. Shown the campus and was given a nice tour. Felt like I got a good sense of the place and met everyone top down and bottom up. Was assured that I would receive mentorship as well as time and resources to build my career.
Interview Questions: What could I bring to USC

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview was brief and friendly, but mainly about business. They liked that I had worked before with teenagers. I knew my references were solid, so I was pretty relaxed. The lady doing the hiring was nice, but I didn't end up working for her. They don't have a lot of turnover in the department I worked in though I don't think job satisfaction was that high. People looked like they stayed for lack of better options, so there's a lot of buried resentment and apathy.
Interview Questions: How are you in high-stress environments?

title: Tutoring Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers are always very nice and you will have met the interviewer many times before, because you must have worked as a tutor before you will be brought on as the coordinator or assistant coordinator of the program.  They make you feel comfortable, but are very interested to know why you will be the best for the program and why you are passionate.  They want to know that you will be dedicated and that you will be a strong leader for your entire group of tutors.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be the program coordinator and what specific vision will you contribute?

title: Financial Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: interview was 1-1. Deloitte Tax consultant position. the interviewer was very nice but also very smart.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Southern California in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Interview can take approximately four hours and is done by a panel of five USC Leadership folks.Expect reference checks. USC does this before hiring someone and can probably find out a great deal of information about the candidate's knowledge, experience, and work habits by asking for information from present and former employers and from others who are familiar with the applicant.

There are also incredible background checks. Expect personal credit checks of an applicant's credit and/or criminal record. A "consumer reporting agency" is hired to prepare a consumer report 33 or an investigative consumer report 34 about an applicant, certain disclosure requirements are imposed under the federal Fair Credit Reporting Act. .
Interview Questions:
Why haven't you found a new position before now?
Have you ever thought of leaving your present position before? If yes, what do you think kept you there?
What do you think of your boss?
What other types of jobs or companies are you considering?
Where would you like to be 5 years or 10 years from now?
What are your weaknesses?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Southern California in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions:
The application, transcripts and test scores you send to the Graduate Admission Office are evaluated to ensure that they meet the minimum standards set by USC and the academic department to which you are applying.
The application is then forwarded to your department, where it is collated with the required supplemental materials (e.g., portfolio, writing samples) you have supplied.
An admission committee consisting of departmental admission officers and faculty members specializing in your field of study review all your application materials and make a final decision. Decisions on the awarding of fellowships and assistantships are also made at this time.
You receive a letter from the USC Dean of Admission, notifying you of your admission status.
Interview Questions: N/A
